page.title: 15SOUTHAMPTON AIRPORT
page.content: {Southampton Airport,}just 3 miles from the city centre, provides {communications}to Amsterdam (12 weekly flights), Exeter (6 flights), Guernsey (34 flights), Jersey (61 flights), Paris (5 flights) (All Air U.K. flights). The Guernsey and Jersey {flights}cost Â£37 (single). Aurigny Air Services Ltd. give 43 weekly flights to Alderney at Â£33.30 (single). A concrete runway was built. It was first put into use on 10, September, 1965. This runway was 5509ft long and 120ft wide. The addition of a British Rail station and a motorway link has seen an increase in traffic and{trade, particularly between Southampton and the Channel Islands. In 1983 the airport saw 300000 passengers and 12000 scheduled flights take place plus 55000 additional flights.
